snippet: A federal appeals court issued a potentially far-reaching decision Friday that allows the victims of Nazi-related looting to press ahead with efforts to reclaim stolen artwork.
abstract: Federal appeals court in California clears way for lawsuit by Marei Von Saher to reclaim Lucas Cranach the Elder painting stolen by the Nazis from her father-in-law Jacques Goudstikker; decision may affect future such lawsuits.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court issued a potentially far-reaching decision Friday that allows the victims of Nazi-related looting to press ahead with efforts to reclaim stolen artwork.

headline.main: Nazi Art-Looting Case May Proceed, Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Nazi Art-Looting Case May Proceed, Court Rules
